block.p: A Hawaiian investment group said it was considering the purchase of Ameron Inc., a Monterey Park, Calif., construction products manufacturer. In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, the investment group said that it had talked with third parties about financing an acquisition but that no agreements had been reached.

The investment group already controls 8.5 percent of Ameron's 3.7 million shares outstanding. The group is led by two Hawaiian businessmen, Jay H. Shidler and James C. Reynolds. Ameron's stock rose 25 cents today, to $35.50, on the New York Stock Exchange.
